title: We introduced Eva Chen and Mary H.K. Choi on the phone. They bonded over ‘The Baby-Sitters Club,’ immigrant parents and more.
text: But the best thing is over the weekend, on the playground, when I meet someone and they’re like, “My daughter or son loves your book.” I freak them out because I start crying. Tom is always like, “You need to stop crying when someone tells you they like your book.” I can’t help it. … It’s literally the most vulnerable I’ve ever felt. When you write for a magazine, the publication is still kind of the accountable one if people don’t like it. But if someone doesn’t like your book, it’s like your soul.
